description: From Latin sandaraca, from Ancient Greek σανδαράκη (sandarákē, “realgar”).

entries.meaning: (mineralogy, archaic) Realgar; red sulphide of arsenic.
(chemistry) A white or yellow resin obtained from a north African tree (Tetraclinis articulata), and pulverized for pounce; probably so called from a resemblance to the mineral.
examples: Sandarach is procured from common juniper; and incense from a juniper with yellow fruit.

entries.meaning: Any tree from the genus Tetraclinis.
